articles.author: Granth Vanaik
articles.description: Workers at hundreds of Starbucks (SBUX.O) stores have begun walking off their jobs during a key promotional event on Thursday, demanding improved staffing and schedules, the Workers United said on social media platform X.
articles.title: Starbucks employees at hundreds of US stores walkout on 'Red Cup' day

articles.author: Anna Tong
articles.description: OpenAI, whose generative AI products initially raised fears of widespread cheating on homework, is now exploring how it can get its popular ChatGPT chatbot into classrooms, according to a senior executive.
articles.title: Exclusive: OpenAI explores how to get ChatGPT into classrooms

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The number of Americans filing new claims for unemployment benefits increased more than expected last week, suggesting that labor market conditions continued to ease, which could help the Federal Reserve's fight against inflation.
articles.title: US weekly jobless claims rise more than expected

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Walmart (WMT.N) raised its annual sales and profit forecast on Thursday for the second straight quarter, signaling a strong start to the holiday season.
articles.title: Walmart lifts targets as shoppers pick low-priced groceries for the holiday

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Walgreens Boots Alliance (WBA.O) will close nearly all of its stores and pharmacies on Thanksgiving Day for the first time in the chain's history to give staff "time with their loved ones", the company said on Thursday.
articles.title: Walgreens to close nearly all pharmacies on Thanksgiving for first time

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The U.S. government went back to basics in arguments against Alphabet's (GOOGL.O) Google on Thursday, wrapping up the evidentiary phase of a court battle in which it has accused the online search leader of breaking antitrust law with its tactics.
articles.title: US wraps up antitrust case against Google in historic trial

articles.author: David Kirton
articles.description: Tony Xiong is among the latest arrivals to the glitzy office towers in the newest part of Shenzhen, built to showcase China's economic miracle. He won't spend any personal time in the area.
articles.title: China's not-so-special economic zone embodies a harsh new reality

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Emily Rose
articles.description: Israel said its forces were operating in and around Gaza's biggest hospital, a chief objective in its campaign to destroy Palestinian Hamas militants that the army says stored weapons and ran a command centre in tunnels beneath the buildings.
articles.title: Israeli troops deepen search at main Gaza hospital for evidence of Hamas

articles.author: Special Reports
articles.description: Appin was a leading Indian cyberespionage firm that few people even knew existed. A Reuters investigation found that the company grew from an educational startup to a hack-for-hire powerhouse that stole secrets from business titans, politicians, military officials and wealthy elites around the globe. Appin alumni went on to form other firms that are still active today.
articles.title: How an Indian startup hacked the world

articles.author: Alexandra Alper, Michael Martina
articles.description: The Biden administration on Thursday removed the Chinese Ministry of Public Security’s Institute of Forensic Science from a trade sanction list, part of a bid to convince Beijing to do more to halt the flow of the synthetic opioid fentanyl into the United States.
articles.title: Biden removes sanctions from Chinese institute in push for fentanyl help
